measured_by: sum of preference rankings across 10 trials
justification: In Experiment 1, "Participants either chose a pattern … The dependent variable was therefore the sum of the preferences over each of the choice types across each of the 10 trials." This defines the construct (preference for the patterns) and the measure (summed ranking counts).

For Experiment 2, "The dependent variable was the slider value of the participant … these values ranged from 1 to 100, where higher values indicated more agreement with the right-wing view and lower values indicated more agreement with the more left-wing view." Thus, political belief agreement is captured with a numeric slider scale.
After the main task, "participants were asked to state which party they most affiliated with (Democrat or Republican)," indicating party affiliation was measured by a direct self-report item.
